sen.j: 行玄（ぎょうげん、承徳元年（1097年） － 久寿2年11月5日 (旧暦)（1155年12月1日））は、平安時代後期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Gyogen (1097- December 1, 1155) was a Buddhist monk of Tendai Sect in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 母は源師房の娘或いは藤原隆家の孫藤原忠俊の娘で、同母弟に尋範がいる。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Minamoto no Morofusa or a daughter of FUJIWARA no Tadatoshi, a grandchild of FUJIWARA no Takaie, and Jinpan was his half younger brother with the same mother.

sen.j: 比叡山に上って出家し、1116年（永久 (元号)4年）20歳の時良祐から灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: He became a monk at Hieizan (Mt. Hiei) and received kanjo (ceremony to be the successor) from Ryosuke in 1116 when he was 20 years old.

sen.j: 1135年（保延元年）中宮の病気平癒の加持を修し、その賞として法務に任じられている。
sen.e: In 1135, he conducted incantation for curing chugu's (the second empress's) disease and was appointed to Homu (director of temple affairs) as reward.

sen.j: 1138年（保延4年）僧正となり、1142年（康治元年）鳥羽天皇・藤原忠実に授戒を行う。
sen.e: He was conferred the title of Sojo (the second highest title of monks) in 1138 and gave Buddhist precepts to the Emperor Toba and FUJIWARA no Tadazane in 1142.

sen.e: He was conferred the title of Daisojo (the highest title of Buddhist monks) in 1145.

sen.j: 1150年（久安6年）最勝寺経供養の日を祈祷により晴天にしたことにより、住房を皇后の祈願寺とし、青蓮院と称された。
sen.e: In 1150, after he successfully made the weather fine by his prayer on the day of Keisho-ji Temple's Buddhist service, he converted his living house into a temple where the empresses pray and named it Shoren-in Temple.

sen.j: 1153年（仁平3年）には延暦寺・法勝寺・景勝寺などの職を辞し、2年後青蓮院で没した。
sen.e: He resigned from his posts at Enryaku-ji Temple, Hossho-ji Temple and Keisho-ji Temple etc. in 1153 and died two years later at Shoren-in Temple.
